description.narrative: 1,000 HH kits distribution (5 people/HH) => 5,000 people 15 latrines (100 people/latrine) => 1,500 people Water Treatment Station (37500 liters/day, 15 l/p/d) => 2,500 people Malnutrition screening of 875 children under 5 => 875 people (as screening will be conducted in Delacour site where WASH kits won't be distributed by AAH as already distributed by another partner, and in neighbouring areas of official sites where there was no kits distribution, it is estimated that 500 children under 5 will be screened without double counting) Without double counting: 5,000 (HH kits) + 2,500 (Water Treatment Station) + 500 (screened children) = 8000 beneficiaries

ACF started to intervene 5 days after the first joint assessment distributing WASH kits to ensure the access to drinking water and capacities to contain it, sensitization have been made to ensure hygiene promotion. Active screenings were carried out referencing MAS cases in OTP/ ITFC (every 2 weeks) and follow-up is done through home visit when necessary. During the follow-up, the Mental Health & Care Practices (MHCP) is associated (workshop of entrance / workshop of exit / session of relaxation).
